name: Ditto

abilities.name: Transform
abilities.text: If Ditto is your Active Pokémon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokémon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokémon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokémon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

flavorText: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

strengths: Can copy any opposing Pokemon's attacks and stats
Energy attached counts as any type needed
Forces opponents to consider what they make active
weaknesses: Fighting weakness is problematic against Haymaker
Has no attacks of its own
Vulnerable when Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed
synergies: Double Colorless Energy (counts as any 2 energy)
Full Heal (to remove status and restore Transform)
counters: Hitmonchan and Fighting types exploit weakness
Gust of Wind to force Ditto active when disadvantageous
Low-HP Pokemon as your active limits Ditto's copied HP

competitiveHistory: This non-holo version of Ditto is functionally identical to the holo version (#3). Ditto's Transform power was one of the most unique mechanics in the game, creating interesting tactical decisions. The non-holo printing made this complex card more accessible to players.

rulings.ruling: Ditto copies the Defending Pokemon's current HP maximum, not damage taken. If the Defending Pokemon has 100 HP, Ditto has 100 HP.
Energy attached to Ditto can be treated as any type when using copied attacks.
If the Defending Pokemon has a Pokemon Power, Ditto does NOT copy that power - only Transform is active.
Ditto cannot evolve even if the Pokemon it's copying could normally evolve.
If Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed, it reverts to its printed stats (50 HP, Colorless type, etc.)
Ditto on the Bench is not transformed and has its normal printed characteristics.
